thread.title_full: Games of the Week in New Jersey

title: Games of the Week in New Jersey
locations: New Jersey Pat PJR Rice Talk
text: Games of the Week in New Jersey Pat PJR Rice Talk about it in NJHoops Hardwood Talk Jackson (3-0) at Brick (3-0), Friday night. Two of the top programs in the Shore Conference meet. Last year's regular season game was an overtime classic, won by Brick, but Jackson turned the tables and won the rematch in the playoffs, 44-0. Jackson has outscored the opposition, 124-10, in three games and Brick has a similar 99-6 score in their first three games. The Jackson defense is led by LB Adante Davis and the TB duo of Mike Gawlik and Vincent Lee is the offensive focus. Brick is featuring the talents of WR Ja'sir Taylor, RB Jay Obernauer, and three year starting center Alex Trapasso. Dan Pinelli Rumson-Fair Haven (2-0) at St. John Vianney (3-0), Friday night. St. John Vianney won last year's game in a wild 35-28 affair. Vianney has the explosive offense against a Rumson-Fair Haven team that has pitched two shutouts. Boston College bound QB Anthony Brown and WR Khalil Haskins are two of the big weapons for Vianney, while RFH has QB Mike O'Connor to make plays and LB Max Pfrang leads the defense. Wayne Hills (4-0) at Pascack Valley (3-0), Friday 6PM. Pascack Valley, the recent power, goes against an old power looking to recapture its invincibility of a few years ago. Pascack Valley has been challenged by Hackensack and Montclair, while Wayne Hills has yet to be tested. Valley has QB Colin Dedrick, a three year starter, and WR/DB Mike Pimpinella, while the ringleaders for Wayne Hills is TE/LB Joe Kenny and two way lineman Leyshawn Askew. Penns Grove (3-0) at Salem (3-0), Friday night . Salem won last year, 12-0 and this could be a good defensive battle, as Penns Grove has allowed 22 points and Salem 14, so far. Salem is looking to return to the finals and their offense is led by QB Shareef Jefferies and RB Jonathan Taylor. Penns Grove had two TD's by sophomore Samej Moore and one of their top defenders is linebacker Javar Garrett. Cranford (3-0) at Summit (3-0), Saturday afternoon. Two undefeated Union County teams square off Saturday afternoon, with Cranford winning last year's game, 33-14. Cranford has Villanova commit and returning quarterback Jack Schetelich, along with lineman and Penn State recruit Will Fries leading the line. Summit has QB Jack Froschauer and their leading lineman is Harvard commit Matteo diMayorca.
